section.title: History of Present Illness
section.text: Henry Levin, the 7th is a 67 year old male referred for further asthma management. Onset of asthma in his twenties teens. He was hospitalized twice last year, and already twice this year. He has not been able to be weaned off steroids for the past several months.

list.item: Father had fatal MI in his early 50's.
Smoking :: 1 PPD between the ages of 20 and 55, and then he quit.

section.title: Skin Exam
section.text: Erythematous rash, palmar surface, left index finger.

targetSiteCode.displayName: Skin of palmer surface of index finger

section.title: Lungs
section.text: Clear with no wheeze. Good air flow.

section.title: Cardiac
section.text: RRR with no murmur, no S3, no S4.

list.item: CXR 02/03/1999: Hyperinflated. Normal cardiac silhouette, clear lungs.
Asthma, with prior smoking history. Difficulty weaning off steroids. Will try gradual taper.

targetSiteCode.displayName: Skin of palmer surface of index finger
